intro: Lomaria angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, white or greenish flowers appear in umbel-like clusters, making it a distinctive addition to native plant gardens. Lomaria angustifolia is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
